DOC.brief_summary: The objective of this study is to test the effectiveness of a collaborative care approach to improving outpatient treatment for inactivity, chronic pain and depression as a way of improving overall Quality of Life for patients with SCI.
DOC.brief_title: Spinal Cord Injury Collaborative Care Study
DOC.criteria: 18 years of age or older diagnosis of traumatic spinal cord injury by medical record review receives primary SCI care from a provider at the University of Washington or Harborview Medical Center's Rehabilitation Outpatient Clinic positive screening for pain related to SCI diagnosis and/or positive screening for low mood and/or negative screening for physical activity levels able to speak and understand English psychiatric condition that would interfere with participation major surgery in the next 8 months
